page.title: 03Our School (sheet 1)
page.content: In our D-block there is one school which is called Blackmoor Church of England Primary School.The school is church aided and the Reverend R.J. Inkpen comes and teaches us about the church.Blackmoor School was built in 1962 to replace the old school which was in Village Hall.There are four classrooms in the main building and two in a temporary one. There are plans for a new room to be built onto the main building which will house the library,video,computer and television.A porch is also going to be built onto the entrance.In each class there is a teacher and 30-35 children.Mrs Kuchemann teaches the 4-5 year olds in class one.Mrs Holland teaches the 5-6 year olds in class two.Miss Gray teaches the 6-7 year olds in class three. By Hilary Taylor and Gary Perry
